pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Prime Minister Theresa May of the United Kingdom | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke today with Prime Minister Theresa May of the United Kingdom.

Prime Minister Trudeau offered his sympathy to the United Kingdom and Prime Minister May regarding the despicable and reckless poisoning of Sergei and Yulia Skripal and Detective Sergeant Nick Bailey. The leaders noted the conversations that have occurred between their governments on this matter, and Prime Minister Trudeau pledged Canada's ongoing commitment to the United Kingdom, our close friend and NATO ally.

Prime Minister Trudeau expressed his solidarity with the United Kingdom and offered his steadfast support in holding Russia to account for its unacceptable behaviour. 

The Prime Ministers also discussed the upcoming Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting taking place in London, from April 16 to 20, 2018.
